item.title: Palworld’s Ultrakill Collab Arrives in December 2025 with ‘Home Sweet Home’ Update
item.content:encoded:
Palworld’s Ultrakill crossover finally has a release date, and the update is scheduled to arrive on December 17, 2025.

Pocketpair announced Palworld’s crossover with the fast-paced, ultraviolent retro FPS, Ultrakill, back in September 2025; however, at the time, we were only told that players would be able to experience iconic weapons from the FPS. Now, a new trailer reveals all the content the crossover entails, along with a tease for update 1.0.

Home Sweet Home Update as Ultrakill Collab Along with New Base Customization Options

The new trailer kicks off with an Ultrakill character showcasing all the latest weapons players can use in Palworld with the upcoming update. A few of these weapons have shots that can change their trajectories mid-travel to hit their targets, and some have explosive capabilities as well. Some weapons also have the ability to deflect some attacks right back at the Pals with the help of coins. The Home Sweet Home update will also add the ability to colour your bases, along with the new customization option.

That’s not all: towards the end of the trailer, we cut to a black screen, with the music and theme completely changing. For a split second, we see a humongous Pal’s silhouette intimidating the characters in the area before the trailer ends with the words, “Palworld 1.0 -2026”. For those unaware, the release of Palworld 1.0 will mark the game’s exit from early access, and its release window was announced earlier this year.

In other news, Nintendo’s patent in the Palworld dispute is being reexamined by the USPTO. Additionally, an anti-Palworld patent was recently rejected in Japan. What are your thoughts on Palworld’s new Ultrakill crossover and base customizations in the Home Sweet Home update? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Stellar Blade becoming the best-selling PlayStation-exclusive launch IP in history for PC. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Suffers Worst Japan Launch In 20-Year Franchise History
item.content:encoded:
It wasn’t beyond the realms of possibility for Black Ops 7 to struggle in 2025. The shooter market is fierce, and the impact of rival franchises seems to have hit Black Ops 7 hard, as it’s recorded the worst Japanese retail launch sales ever in the series.

The poor reception to Modern Warfare 3 didn’t stop Black Ops 6 from bringing the franchise back with a bang. It was a tough task for Black Ops 7 to repeat this success, and early gameplay footage and trailers didn’t do much for the game’s hopes. The realisation hit home hard when it was reported that Black Ops 7 sales were down 50% in Europe.

Japan’s Black Ops 7 sales have hit a new low.

Lowest Call of Duty Retail Sales In Japanese History For Black Ops 7

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7’s first week retail launch sales (shown by @Zuby_Tech) were 12,311—with the PS4 version reportedly adding to this by allegedly selling under 1,800 copies.

According to a graphic, this is lower than 2007’s Call of Duty 3, which registered 14,117 retail launch units. It doesn’t include the first two Call of Duty titles, but there’s every chance that the result would be the same.

The Japanese market certainly isn’t one of the most popular for Call of Duty games. However, when we’re looking at overall data—factoring in Europe sales again—patterns are emerging across the board. Black Ops 7 isn’t being well-received.

It would be interesting to see how Black Ops 7 would have done without competition, but the fact is that Battlefield 6 and ARC Raiders are both doing exceptionally well with sales and player count numbers. The Battlefield 6 versus Black Ops 7 player count debate was over in one week.

Interest in Call of Duty is currently as low as it’s been for years. Head to the Insider Gaming Discord Server and share your thoughts on whether this is a wake-up call for Activision or not. What does the company need to do for Call of Duty 2026 to rectify the situation?

If you enjoyed this story, you might enjoy reading about Stellar Blade Being ‘The Best-Selling PlayStation-Exclusive Launch IP In History’ For PC.

item.title: Stellar Blade Is ‘The Best-Selling PlayStation-Exclusive Launch IP In History’ For PC
item.content:encoded:
Every new update on Stellar Blade seems to suggest that the game has defied all expectations. Now, it’s understood that Stellar Blade has beaten out Ghost of Tsushima, God of War, Marvel’s Spider-Man, and others to be the best-selling PlayStation exclusive on PC.

Stellar Blade news has been coming thick and fast recently. A Stellar Blade sequel is confirmed to be in development, and the bombshell was dropped that Stellar Blade is going multiplatform. The original game was a success on launch and continues to escalate in terms of popularity and sales.

Shift Up has revealed a new graphic showing this to be the case.

Stellar Blade Destroys Other PlayStation Exclusives On PC

Stellar Blade developer Shift Up showed off an impressive chart showing the biggest PlayStation-exclusive games that have received a PC port.

The graphic (shown by Genki) shows the top six games for sales on PC. The data shows Stellar Blade hit a peak of 192,000 concurrent players on Steam at launch, with the next best being 77,000 players for Ghost of Tsushima.

The headline sentence also says: “Best-selling PlayStation-exclusive launch IP in history.”

Based on the numbers, this isn’t just the case; it’s conclusive. We reported a couple of weeks ago that Shuhei Yoshida ‘Absolutely Wanted’ Stellar Blade on PlayStation after playing it. PC players eventually got a chance to experience it—which was clearly snapped up!

The game’s appeal continues to grow as a Stellar Blade x Silent Hill f crossover was teased, and owners have new content to play, including 3 new epilogues.

Head to the Insider Gaming Official Discord Server and let everyone know what you think of Stellar Blade. Is this a case of a series where the second game can overtake the first game’s success?

For more IG news, read about A leak suggesting Fortnite is adding new Animated favorites as Sidekicks. Plus, check out Call of Duty, OD Actor, Udo Kier, sadly passing away.

item.title: PIONER, An All-New Post-Apocalyptic MMO, Launches December 16
item.content:encoded:
GFA Games has announced that PIONER, an ambitious post-apocalyptic MMO, will launch in early access on December 16, 2025. This date comes mere weeks after a successful beta test, which saw the game skyrocket to over 500,000 wishlists on Steam. The PC-exclusive MMO has been described as a perfect balance between the likes of Fallout, STALKER, and Escape from Tarkov.

PIONER features a massive open-world environment, stacks of customization options, and an immersive atmosphere that encourages players to prioritize exploration and development over anything else.

PIONER Hits Early Access Soon

PIONER, which has been compiled by GFA Games, a studio headquartered in Serbia, is set to be released in early access on December 16. This news dropped today, along with a new trailer, which you can see below:

The team at GFA Games also revealed the Deluxe Edition of PIONER, which comes with stacks of digital content:

  • Unique Skin: “Renegade” – a unique, exclusive armor and gear design
  • Weapon Skin with VFX – a unique weapon skin for the entire AR platform, including AR-12,
    AR-16, and AR-16 Ifrit
  • Exclusive Founder Title – a status symbol for social interaction
  • Premium Currency – 500 Efritanium Crystals
  • Weapon Accessory: “Creepy Charm” – cosmetic trinket for a weapon
  • Gadget: “Katana” Watch – inspired by the iconic 80s Japanese watch design; a retro-futuristic style that fits the world of PIONER

The game’s blurb reveals how much potential this game has:

PIONER takes players to a vast, atmospheric post-apocalyptic island, where remnants of the Soviet era create an incredible alternate reality. The game emphasizes realism over traditional mechanics, offering an open world of over 50 km2 filled with hidden dungeons, story quests, and faction missions that influence alliances and rewards. As a social-focused MMO, PIONER combines story-driven exploration with intense PvE and PvP gameplay. Players shape the world through their actions.

PIONER has an expansive campaign that eases players in with a great tutorial section, and it has grown over several years of development to become something that could stun in early access.

Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you intend to invest in PIONER.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that ARC Raiders soared in early sales

item.title: Hytale ‘Receives Blessing’ to Include Technoblade Tribute
item.content:encoded:
Hytale will feature a tribute to Technoblade in future after permission was granted by the content creator’s father, with fans urged to submit their ideas for the tribute.

Youtuber Technoblade, who passed in June 2022 after a battle with cancer, was a prominent Minecraft YouTuber, often using the Hypixel server that eventually spawned into Hytale, and he is set to be commemorated in the game.

Technoblade Tribute Coming to Hytale

In a post on X (formerly Twitter), Hypixel Studios founder Simon Collins-Laflamme shared that the team had received the blessing of Technoblade’s father to “add something in Hytale that represents Technoblade’s memory.”

He added that Technoblade was “a big part of our journey with Hypixel,” and he wishes for “him to be a part of this one as well,” and the doors are now open to suggestions.

Players have been urged to submit their ideas for a “meaningful tribute” for Technoblade, who, it was revealed, applied to work for Hypixel Studios’ marketing team a decade ago but was too young at the time.

Suggestions shared on social media so far include rare odds for a pig to spawn as Techoblade, a special weapon, or a boss fight.

Technoblade already received a tribute in Minecraft after his passing, with the splash image for the title showcasing a pig wearing a golden crown—a callout to the iconic skin he used in his videos.

After revealing his diagnosis with cancer in August 2021, Technoblade raised over $300,000 dollars for the Sarcoma Foundation of America, smashing the quarter of a million goal within two hours, and his YouTube channel posthumously reached 20 million subscribers in May 2025.

What ideas do you have for a Technoblade tribute in Hytale? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Hytale, check out the reveal of two features in the works, and take a look at the pricing structure for the game.
